features: Best Air Ionizer For Home: Simply plug a Clarifion into any standard outlet and replace bulky, expensive air purifiers with a simple, filterless, plug-in device.
Perfect For Every Room: We recommend using at least one per bedroom, bathroom, dining room, living room, and kitchen to ensure best results.
No Air Filter Required: Clarifion uses negative ion technology, which means you won’t have to spend time and money on replacement air filters.
May Help With Allergens: Negative ions attach to floating allergens like dust, dander, pollen, and more. Use Clarifion air ionizer and freshener for pets and pet dander.
Compact & Portable: Clarifion is small, lightweight, and compact, making it the perfect small air cleaner. Take it with you on the go and simply plug it into any standard outlet.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Next page 1 How It Works 2 Air Purifier vs Clarifion 3 Easy Operation

How does Clarifion work? Clarifion uses negative ions that may attach to some airborne pollutants in the air. Negative ions are known to weigh these down and sink them to the ground. Where can I use it? We recommend using at least one in bedrooms, bathrooms, dining rooms, living rooms, office, and more. Does Clarifion require installation? Just open the box and plug it in! It starts working as soon as it’s plugged in, so you’ll have it releasing negative ions in less than 60 seconds. Will it work on any outlet? Yes! It works in any standard outlet, making it incredibly convenient to use in any room, even in hotels and offices! How noisy is it when on? It’s nearly silent as it works, so you’ll never hear it. Plus, customers love the discreet blue nightlight.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I’ve only had this plugged in for about a weekSo I am not sure how it’s going to work in the long run but I feel like it cleans the air in the area I needed it and I’m very tempted to buy more for more rooms. It’s so small plugs right into your outlet. It’s great so I’ve noticed a bit of a difference as I said, it’s only been a week so I would recommend trying them depends on your space and the odors in your house

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Clean Air Ionizer for Home - Clarifion Air Ionizers
reviews.reviewText: I previously utilized a large, cumbersome air filter for my home. However, I recently came across the Clarifion unit, which I have found to be a valuable addition—remarkably user-friendly. Upon receiving the unit, I simply unpacked it, plugged it in, and that was it—no more hassle. This eliminates the need for purchasing expensive air filters and is particularly suitable for a mid-sized room (mine is placed in the family room). I intend to acquire additional units for the bedrooms and kitchen.The unit operates silently, and its functionality is indicated by a discreet blue light. Say goodbye to dust, dander, pollen, and unwanted odors!I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great but find they don’t last long
reviews.reviewText: Hoping the seller will contact me. I have several of these and I tend on buying more for other rooms but I’m finding they don’t all last long. I’ve had a couple stop working after 2-3 months. I wipe them off as instructed but not sure why some lady and others don’t. Help needed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Bright Blue Light keeps me awake at night!
reviews.reviewText: I haven't really had this long enough to know whether it works well, or not. I bought it for my bedroom, that gets dusty & stuffy. However, I don't believe I'll be able to use it because the power light (blue light) is so bright that it lights up my whole bedroom and keeps me awake at night. Blue light is not good for you while sleeping. So, I'll either have to unplug it at night, which kind of defeats the purpose, or move it to another room, which also defeats the purpose, so I'm a little disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don't Buy the Hype...and prevent fires!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this for a small bathroom that can occasionally smell stale. I saw reviews that said it was amazing in a large room, so figured a small bathroom would be great. Nope.In fairness -- the use is extremely easy -- open the box and plug in. I was even able to plug it into an outlet approximately 4 feet from the floor - close to the "ideal" 5 feet from the floor (which would be very unusual in a non-bathroom.) I closed the door and left it overnight and most of the next morning. I walked in close to 24 hours later - no difference at all. OK, it's a small device.... maybe it takes some time? So I left it for 2 more days - plugged in, 24 hours/day, no one in or out of the room. MAYBE there was a slight difference in the air at that point -- SLIGHTLY less stale? But definitely not $40 worth of change, especially if it requires multiple days to make even that slight difference. So I decided to unplug it to package it back up for return.That's where things got a bit frightening -- the device was HOT to the touch -- not just warm, but HOT...hot enough I had to drop it onto the counter after unplugging it. I was shocked (figuratively, not literally electrocuted). This is a device you are supposed to plug in and forget about -- the "warning" said to wipe it down every 10 - 14 days, but this had been 3 days and it was HOT. I can't imagine where it would be after 14 days?! I got online in surprise and discovered the reviews about it catching fire -- I have ZERO doubt or surprise. I can't imagine if you plugged this in and left it for a month or more -- which it would be easy to do!Bottom line? It would be great if a small plug in device could ionize the air and make the room air fresh and pure...but it's definitely NOT worth burning down your house to get that fresh air!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LESS DUST IN THE AIR...I'M SURE...
reviews.reviewText: Newly refurbished, detailed townhouse with central HVAC...wall to wall carpet yet fine white dust noticed on surfaces. Mounted the ionizer in the bedroom and the air seems cleaner. It doesn't eliminate dust, the dust drops to the floor and can be vacuumed up. I like the product, I'm sure it's doing what its designed to do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Plug it in and leave it alone. No fuss no mess and no trying to understand someone else's how to. It works great, noticed the difference a few hours later and the smell hasn't returned. Great buy, good item picked. Does exactly what you would expect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Only last months
reviews.reviewText: I loved the Clarifion Air Filers but they only last months. I kept them in hopes of finding a way to make them work, but there isn't. I never replaced them because I can't afford to. They are supposed to last forever or atleast for years. Each one I purchased has gone out at different times so I just used what I had left. Please let me know if you can give me a discount on a pack of 3 or a pack of 6. I really need them and have to figure something out. Thanks for your help.
